note: Title from colophon (f. 49v). Title given in text (f. 2r) is Spandārthasūtrāvalī. Title page (f. 1r) reads Saṭīkāspandavivṛtiprārabhā.|Copied by a brāhmaṇa named Rājānakanidhāna in Kāśī.|Written 13-18 lines per leaf.|Good condition. The first several leaves have come loose from the binding. Part of the text is in brown ink. Mistakes are covered over with yellow, blotched out with black, or indicated by 2 horizontal lines above the syllable in question. Many of the Spandasūtras and some words are highlighted with orange powder. Significant marginal additions.|Begins: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ. daśādikkālāghair akalitacidālokavapuṣaḥ sadā tādṛḱsvātmānubhavitṛtayāvisphuritayaḥ. nijodharmaḥ śaṁbhor anupamacamatkārasarasaḥ paraṁ ́sāktaṁ tattvaṁ jayati jagati spanda iti tat.|Colophon, ff. 49v-50r: saṁpūrṇeyaṁ vṛtyanusāriṇī spandavivṛttiḥ kṛtis tatrabhavato mahāmh̄eśvarācāryaśiromaṇirājānakaśrīmadutpaladevānujīvino rājānakaśrīrāmasyeti śivam. likhitaṁ mayā rājānanidhānākhyavipreṇa svātmamaheśvaravinodārtham kāśyāṁ madhye trilocanacaraṇakamalasamīpe sthitvā pilapilākṣetranivāsamānena śrīgurubālārkasadṛśakāntābālakarāmākhyapreraṇayā likhitaṁ mayā. śrīparamaśivārpaṇam astu. saṁvat 1877 caitramāse kṛṣṇapakṡe amāvasyāṁ somavāsare sampūrṇam iti śubham astu sarvajagatāṁ.

note: The Śivanāmakalpalatālavāla of Bhāskararāya, with an incomplete commentary, Sudhāpū [Sudhāpūra], by Veṅkaṭācalasūri [Veṅkaṭācalapaṇḍita]. Commentary present only on the last portion of the text (ff. 16r-end), subsequent to the exposition on the 108 names of Śiva.|Title Śivanāmakalpalatālavāla from colophon of commentary (f. 19r). Colophon of text (f. 18v) supplies Śivanāmāṣṭaśata as the title. Title of commentary from Aufrecht's Catalogus Catalogorum (2.154) and the critical edition (Śivanāmakalpalatālavāla of Śrī Bhāskararāya ,H. V. Nagaraja Rao, ed., Oriental Research Institute Series, no. 146 [Mysore: Oriental Research Institute, 1985]). The title supplied in the ms. (f. 19r) is Sudhāpū.|Text cataloged incorrectly by Poleman as Śivanāmakalpalatā.|Written 7 lines per leaf.|Good condition. Mistakes indicated by two horizontal lines above the syllable in question. Marginal corrections.|Text begins: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ. mokṣasyaikanidānam avjanayanabrahme[n]dracandrādibhir devaiḥ prāṇapadīkṛtaṁ kalimalapradhvaṁsi dharmāṅkuraḥ bhāratyāpi sudurnirūpamahitrayyantare gopitaṁ vaktuṙmaṅgaladaṁ śiveti vimalaṁ nāmaiva nastārakaṁ (verse 1).|Colophon of text (f. 18v): iti kāśinivāsisāgnicityakratukṛdbhāskararāyabhāratī januṣaḥsaphalatvasi[d]dhaye śivanāmāṣṭaśataṁ vyavarvarīt.|Colophon of commentary (f. 19r): iti śrīveṅkaṭācalasūripraṇītaḥ śivanāmakalpalatālavālasudhāpūḥ samāptaḥ. śrīsāmbasadāśivārpaṇam astuḥ. yādṛśaṁ pustakaṁ dṛṣṭvạ̄ tādṛśaṁ likhitaṁ mayā. yadi śuddham aśuddhaṁ vā mama doṣo na vidyate.

subject_as_recorded: Shaktism|Shaktism|Kashmir Śaivism|Kashmir Śaivism
note: Title written in black in the center of the upper margin of f. 1r, in a hand other than that of the scribe. Title abbreviations "Kāma" or "Kā" appear on upper left margins of numerous folios. UPenn's handwritten catalog notes and New Cat. Cat. identify the text as part of the Rudrayāmala. No justification for this is apparent, and the text is presumably the same Kāmakalāvilāsa described in New Cat. Cat., vol. 3, as "55 Āryā verses on Devī worship by Puṇyānanda (also called Advaitānanda...) of Kashmir, teacher of Amṛtānandanātha."|Written 7-8 lines per leaf, running into the margins on f. 8v.|Good condition. Text written in brown. Some water damage on ff. 7-8. Mistakes covered over with yellow or blotched out with brown. Marginal corrections in black and brown. Pagination errors.|Begins (f. 1r): śrīguruñ jayati om̐ sakalabhuvanodayasthitilayalīlāvinodano[dbhu?]ktaḥ aṁtarlīnavimarśaḥ pātumaheśaḥ prakāśamātratanuḥ 1|Ends (f. 8): dhāraṇāt tasya sūtrasya nochiṣṭo nāśuci bhavet yadātmāprajñayātmānaṁ saṁdhatte paramātmani tena saṁdhyādhyānam ekaṁ tasmāt saṁdhyābhivadanaṁ 5

note: Title from incipit (f. 1v).|Selection of Tantric works with titles including: Bhūtaśuddhiprāṇapratiṣṭhā (f. 1v-7r), the Navārṇavamantra and its Nyāsa (f. 7v-10v), and Saptaśatikanyānyāsavidhi (f. 10v-15r); also an unidentified section (f. 15r-18v) containing a selection of various topics, such as the Devī and Rātri sūktas, Navārṇavamantra, and the Bhagavatīstavarāja; a variety of Hindu deities are evoked throughout, especially goddesses, as well as a number of Vedic gods such as Agni, Vāyu, and Sūrya; some textual parallels can be made with Item 1434 and Item 1380.|Copied in Mathurā on the banks of the Yamunā River near the Rām Ghāṭ (f. 18r).|Scribe is Putranihāla Maṇī, or Nihāla Maṇī as text was augmented (f. 18r), who appears to have also been the scribe of UPenn Ms. Coll. 390, Item 463.|Written 7 lines per leaf.|Good condition. Mistakes covered over with yellow or gray. Orange powder rubbed in to highlight some invocations and sectional headings. Marginal corrections and lengthy additions.|Incipit: om̐ śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ ācamya prāṇān āyamya adyetyādi mama pūjanajapādau saphalatvasidhyarthe ādau bhūtaśuddhiprāṇapratiṣṭhāṁ ca kariṣye om̐ ādhāraśaktikamalāsanāya namaḥ ity āsanaṁ saṁpūjya tatra prāṅmukha udaṅmukho vā siddhāsane samupaviśya tatra āsana prakārayet (f. 1v).|Colophon of first section: iti bhūtaśuddhiprāṇapratiṣṭhā saṁpūrṇaṁ samāptaḥ (f. 7r).|Explicit: maṁtrahīnaṁ kriyāhīnaṁ bhaktihīnaṁ maheśvari ya stutāsi mayā devi tasmā tvaṁ varadā bhava (f. 17v-18r).|Colophon (final): likhitaṁ mathurāyāṁ rāmaghāṭasyopariyamunā putr[eṇa]nihālamaṇī śubhaṁ patra aṣṭādaśaṁ 18 (f. 18r).|May have been housed at an earlier time with Item 461, Item 463, and Item 464.|Non-Latin script record.

note: Manuscript is likely the first 18 folios of Ms. Coll. 390, Item 1186, which begins on f. 19. While this manuscript has a smaller height than Item 1186, there are clear signs of manuscript repair and alteration and it may well have been cut at some point. The scribal hand looks to be the same and there are similar corrective marks in red throughout. The width of the manuscript, moreover, is the same as the beginning folios of 1186, which has folios of several different widths throughout. The line count of both manuscripts is 9-11 lines per leaf side. The paper quality is also the same or similar. These two manuscripts should likely be read together.|Title from marginal abbreviation (f. 2v).|Written in 9-11 lines per leaf.|18 leaves foliated 1-18, upper left and lower right verso.|Incipit: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ // oṃ namo parabrahmaṇe namaḥ // yasmaniḥ śvasitaṃvedāyovedebhyo khilajagat // (f. 1r).|Scribe is Brahmānandābhidheyabhikṣu as named on Ms. Coll. 390, Item 1186 (f. 100v), which is likely originally part of this manuscript.|Mistakes covered over in yellow or blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins; significant syllables, words, or phrases highlighted in red throughout; vertical margins marked with double red line.

physical_description: Extent: 136, 4 leaves : paper, illustrations ; 300 x 180 (210 x 110) mm bound to 308 x 190 mm
note: Title from incipit (f. 1r).|Foliation: Modern foliation added in pencil, upper left recto; catchwords every verso, lower left.|Layout: 15 long lines, border-ruled.|Script: Written in nastaʻliq in black ink; pointed.|Decoration: Textblock is border-ruled in green, beige, red, and blue with the page-opening ruled in blue. Rubrications in red. The first opening has two polychrome and gold miniatures and the text in cloudbands (f. 1v-2r). Nine other miniatures in bright, primary colors also appear (f. 4v, 31r, 34v, 42v, 48v, 63v, 77v, 96v, 126r).|Binding: Papier-mâché́ covers painted and lacquered with a flowering tree within a polylobed arch on exteriors and doublures. Exterior cover trees are on a green background with yellow arch and orange frame; doublure trees are on an orange background with yellow arch and green frame. A piece of bright blue textile embroidered with white thread covers the spine.|Origin: The copy is not dated, but likely produced in the first half of the 19th century, in India.|Formerly owned by Françoise and Claude Bourelier.|Sold by Sam Fogg Rare Books & Manuscripts (London), 2016.

note: Title from incipit (f. 1r).|Written in 10 lines per leaf.|2 leaves foliated 1-2, upper left and lower right verso.|Incipit: athapaṃcīkaraṇyalikhyate // (f. 1r).|Dated saṃvat 1875 (1818) (f. 2v).|Mistakes blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins; vertical margins marked with double red line.

Includes commentary Bhāgavatabhāvārthadīpikā by Śrīdharasvāmin.|Pagination: folios 1-71a, 71b-84, 1-10.|Folios 1-74. Mistakes covered over with yellow or blanked out with black. Orange powder rubbed in over colophons, some introductions of speakers, and some words. A few marginal corrections by the scribe. Folios 5 verso and 71b recto have been left blank. Folios 75-84, 1-10: Double daṇḍas, one colophon and every other syllable of another colophon in red on folios 75 recto and 10 recto. The double daṇḍas and syllables to be written in red have been omitted from the other folios of this part of the manuscript. The text continues into the right margin on many of the folios. Poleman notes that the text is continuous and that folio 71b verso contains part of the text to be inserted on folio 70a recto.|Written in 12-19 lines per leaf.|Non-Latin script record.

note: Medieval retelling of the epic story of the Rāmāyaṇa, wherein the hero Rāma is identified with the universal spirit (adhyātma) and is nonviolent; narrative takes the form of a dialogue between the Hindu deity Śiva (as Maheśa) and his consort the goddess Pārvatī (as Umā); traditionally ascribed to the legendary author Vyāsa. This fifth section (kāṇḍa) of the Adhyātmarāmāyaṇa contains the narrative about the monkey deity Hanuman's exploration of the island of Laṅkā; he visits the princess Sītā, who is held captive by the demons who live on the island, and sets fire to their main city. Text is incomplete containing only the first six verses of the final, fifth chapter of the work.|Title from title page (f. 1r).|Written in 9 lines per leaf.|22 leaves foliated 1-22, upper left and lower right verso.|Colophon (chapter 4): iti śrīmadadhyā[t]marāmāyaṇe umāmaheśvarasaṃvāde suṃdarakāṃḍe caturthaḥ sargaḥ // 4 // (f. 21v-22r).|Mistakes blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins.|Written on European stock of paper with discernible watermark, possibly of a crown and various letters and/or numbers that are not quite legible.|Non-Latin script record.

note: F. 1r begins with Nivṛttinyāsa (title from ff. 1r and 2r), after which follows Navārṇamantra (title from f. 2r) and its Nyāsa, then Ekādaśanyāsa (title from f. 6r) and a related Dhyāna. The latter half of the manuscript contains a version of Bhūtaśuddhiprāṇapratiṣṭhā (cf. UPenn Ms. Coll. 390, Item 1434 and Item 1380, etc.). Title Bhūtaśuddhyādi from colophon.|Written 7-8 lines per leaf.|Two folios (6a and 6b) numbered as f. 6.|Good condition. Mistakes covered over with yellow or blotched out with black. note: Title from colophon (f. 11v) and cover page (f. 1r). F. 1v gives alternate title Śarabhakavacastotramantra. Cover page reads: athaśarabhakavacaprārambhaḥ. śrī.|Copied by Ābā Śarmaṇ.|Written 9-10 lines per leaf.|Two leaves are given the page number 10.|Good condition.|Begins: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ. atha śarabhakavacastotramantraprārambhaḥ. om̐ asya śrīśarabha[-----]pakṣirājakavacastotramantrasya. Kālāgnirudraṛṣaye namaḥ śirasi. atijagatī chandase namaḥ mukhe. śrīśarabheśvaro devatāyai namaḥ hṛdaye. om̐ bījāya namaḥ guhye.|Ends (f. 11r): yat kṛtyaṁ taṁ na kṛtaṁ yad akṛtyaṁ kṛtyavat tad ācaritaṁ. ubhayor prāyaścittaṁ śiva tava nāmākṣaradvayo caritaṁ.|Colophon: iti śrīmadākāśabhairavakalpe pratyakṣasiddhiprade umāmaheśvarasaṁvāde śarabhakavacaṁ nāmaikacatvāriṁśodhyāyaḥ. śake 1700 vilaṁbī nāma saṁvatsare māghe māsi śuklapakṣe ṣaṣṭyāyāṁ tithau mandavāsaraḥ taddine idaṁ pustakaṁ samāptaṁ. limayopanāmak ābāśarmaṇena likhitaṁ.

subject_as_recorded: Tantrism|Tantrism|Hindu hymns, Sanskrit|Hindu hymns, Sanskrit|Śarabha (Hindu deity)|Hinduism--Rituals--Texts|Hinduism--Rituals
note: Written 12-13 lines per leaf.|Poor condition. Paper is browned and fraying. Orange powder rubbed over section headings and invocations. Mistakes crossed through or blotched out with black. Marginal corrections. Ff. 1-3 torn through middle and repaired. F. 14 torn through middle and repaired, with a hole affecting 4 lines of text. Marginal corrections.|Begins (f. 1v): śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ. śrīḥ om̐ namaḥ pakṣirājāya niśitakuliśavaradaṁ drȧnaravāya anekakoṭibrahmakapālamālālaṁkṛtāya sakalakrūramahānāmabhūṣaṇāya [...].|"Prayoga" begins (f. 2r): atha prayogaḥ. om̐ aiṁ krīṁ śriṁ namo bhagavate śrīśivāya [ya]mayuratḥ jvala 2 prajvala 2 asādhyaṁ sādhaya 2 rakṣa 2 sarva[-]uṣṭebhyo [hu?]ṁ phaṭ svāhā.|"Prayoga" ends (f. 3v): spṛśan yasya japaṁ kṛtvā pratisthānaṁ samāhitaḥ prārthayed akhilaṁ sveṣṭaṁ hradisthaṁ sāluveśvaraṁ (3). śrīśiva.|Śarabhakavaca begins (f. 4r): śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ. athāpi śṛṇu deveśi sarvalakṣaṇam adbhutaṁ śārabhaṁ kavacaṁ nāma caturvargaphalapradaṁ (verse 1). śarabhaḥ pakṣirājasya kavacasya sadāśivaḥ ṛṣiṣ́chandosya bṛhatī procyate śarabheśvaraḥ (verse 2).|Śarabhakavaca ends (f. 8r): ubhayoḥ prāyaścittaṁ śiva tava nāmākṣaradvayaṁ (verse 111).|Colophon f. 8r: iti śrīmatākāśabhairavatantre umāmaheśvarasaṁvāde śarabhakavacaṁ nāmaikādaśaḥ paṭalaḥ.|Śarabhasahasranāmastotra begins (f. 8r): atha stotraṁ. bhairava uvāca. śṛṇu devi mahāguhyaṁ paramaṁ puṇyavar[--]ūnaṁ. śarabheśāṣṭakaṁ mantraṁ vakṣyāmi tava tattvataḥ (verse 1).|Śarabhasahasranāmastotra ends (f. 14v): prayataḥ prātaḥ brahmacā[rya----a?]teṁdriyaḥ. abhinnayogo varṣaṁ tu aśvamedhaphalaṁ labhet.|Colophon f. 14v: ityākāśabhairavatantre kalpe hariharabrahmaviraci[taṁ śabha]rasahasranāmastotraṁ samp[ū]rṇā. śrīvaijanāthāya namaḥ.

[1v]): śrīgaṇeśāya namaḣ. śrīrādhākṛṣṇāya namaḥ. atha gāyatrīkavacaprārambhaḥ. om̐ asya śrīgāyatrīkavacasya. brahmaviṣṇumaheśvaraṛṣibhyo namaḥ. śirasi. ṛgyajusāmātharvānichandosyai namaḥ mukhe. parabrahmavidyāgāyatrīdevatāyāi namaḥ hṛda [-|Ends (f. [3r]): iti śrī agastisaṁhitāyāṁ gāyatrīkavacaṁ samāptaṁ. śake 1716 bhāvanā 0 mārgaśīrṣaśuddha 7 maumavāsare taddīnam idaṁ pustakaṁ samāptaṁ.
